titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Robert W. Hargadine papers, 1867-1869
titlestmt.author: Processed by: Rubenstein Staff; EAD finding aid derived from MARC record using marc2ead_sectionA.xsl

profiledesc.creation: Finding aid derived from MARC record via marc2ead_sectionA.xsl, November 2021

repository.label: Repository
repository.corpname: David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library, Duke University

did.abstract: Letters and papers of Robert W. Hargadine containing rough notes of a thesis at the University of Pennsylvannia for the degree of doctor of medicine, 1867; personal letters from William M. Nickerson, assistant surgeon on the U.S.S. Pensacola; letters from Annie L. Hargadine describing a European tour, 1869; and Hargadine's appointment as a resident physician at St. Mary's Hospital, Philadelphia, Pennsylvannia.

userestrict.head: Use Restrictions
userestrict.p: The copyright interests in this collection have not been transferred to Duke University. For more information, consult the copyright section of the Regulations and Procedures of the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library.

prefercite.p: Robert W. Hargadine Papers, 1867-1869, David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library, Duke University.

processinfo.p: This finding aid was derived from a MARC record using a crosswalk defined in marc2ead_sectionA.xsl. The finding aid was generated as part of a larger project to digitize several thousand small collections housed in Section A, November 2021.

bioghist.head: Historical Note
bioghist.p: Robert W. Hargadine was a physician of Philadelphia, Pennsylvania.

scopecontent.head: Collection Overview
scopecontent.p: Letters and papers of Robert W. Hargadine containing rough notes of a thesis at the University of Pennsylvannia for the degree of doctor of medicine, 1867; personal letters from William M. Nickerson, assistant surgeon on the U.S.S. Pensacola; letters from Annie L. Hargadine describing a European tour, 1869; and Hargadine's appointment as a resident physician at St. Mary's Hospital, Philadelphia, Pennsylvannia.

controlaccess.corpname: University of Pennsylvania. Department of Medicine
